course_title: Description and Analysis of the Chinese Language
class_notes:
(Same as LING 230 1) This class contains synchronous and asynchronous material. It will meet synchronously at the listed day and time, with all other content to be completed asynchronously.


This is an introductory course to Chinese linguistics. It offers an overview of important elements of the Chinese language, including its phonology, vocabulary, grammar, discourse, and its use in society. Students will gain an understanding of the phonological, semantic, and syntactic structures of modern Chinese and examine cultural and social issues surrounding the Chinese language. 
 
This course fulfills GER HAP requirement and is taught in English. All course work will be done in English, but examples are provided in Chinese characters with Pinyin and translation in English.  
 
Prerequisite: CHN102 or equivalent.  
 
Required textbook: 
Shei, Chris. Understanding the Chinese Language: A Comprehensive Linguistic Introduction. London and New York: Routledge, 2014
